text:
Barren Island, north of Flatbush Ave., near P.S. No. 120.

April 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Barren Island.

text:
(1) Barren Island, looking north, showing the north side of the main street in Barren Island and a pastoral scene in the foreground. The church of R.C. denomination is said by the photographer to be Italian.

April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same scene, from another angle.

April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Barren Island - [Brooklyn].

text:
Barren Island, east on Flatbush Ave., near the Rockaway Ferry (extreme southern portion of the island).
April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Barren Island - Rockaway ferry.

text: (1) Barren Island, showing Roadway, which with its abutments was cleared to make way for a new park and approach to the Marine Bridge, which (when completed) will connect this section of Brooklyn with Rockaway. Because of the reconstruction involved, the evacuation of some 350 residents became necessary. April 21, 1931. P. L. Sperr.  (2) The same, further north, showing a water tower and P.S. No. 120. (The only school ever built on the island). These were demolished in June 1936 with all the other buildings to make way for Marine Park. April 21, 1931. P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Barren Island - Roadway - [Water tower.]

text: (1) Barren Island, showing Roadway, which with its abutments was cleared to make way for a new park and approach to the Marine Bridge, which (when completed) will connect this section of Brooklyn with Rockaway. Because of the reconstruction involved, the evacuation of some 350 residents became necessary. April 21, 1931. P. L. Sperr.  (2) The same, further north, showing a water tower and P.S. No. 120. (The only school ever built on the island). These were demolished in June 1936 with all the other buildings to make way for Marine Park. April 21, 1931. P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Barren Island - Roadway - [Water tower.]

text:

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a view further southward. (These buildings have likewise been demolished). April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Islands - Barren Island - [Rockaway Ferry Slip.]

text:
(1) Barren Island, showing "Long Bridge". (This bridge was used to facilitate the filling in of the northern part of the island, preparatory to the construction of Floyd Bennett Field (Municipal airport). April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle. April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same vicinity, a small portion of the bridge may be seen on the extreme left. April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

text: (1) Barren Island, east from Flatbush Ave., showing (left) the old P.S. No. 120, the horse disposal plant and an old hangar used before the establishment of the Floyd Bennett Field (Municipal airport). July 5, 1931. P. L. Sperr.  (2) The same; a view northward, showing a somewhat closer view of the horse disposal plant. April 21, 1931. P. L. Sperr.  (3) The same, showing a view northeast from Flatbush Ave., with the smoke stack in the center background. April 21, 1931. P. L. Sperr.

text:
Jamaica Bay, showing the Sea Bird (excursion steamer) viewed from the east side of Barren Island, north of the glue factory, which was also known as the horse disposal plant. View No. two showing a fishing boat making for port; number three shows also a pier in the background which is used in connection with the Floyd Bennett Airport.

July 5, 1931
Views 1, 2 and 3

P.L. Sperr
title: Islands - Barren Island - Jamaica Bay (Queens) - [Excursion steamer Sea Bird.]

title: Islands - Barren Island (South) - Rockaway ferry slip.

text:
(1) Barren Island, east shore, north from the foot of Hassock Street, showing, in the distance, a disposal plant for the conversion of dead animals into glue. This building, in disuse for years, because of its high chimney that was a menace to aviators at Floyd Bennett Field, was demolished in 1937.

July 26, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a further view north. This pier, an old one, near the disposal plant, was demolished in 1937.

July 5, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Barren Island (North) - East shore.

text:

P. L. Sperr

View 2: July 24, 1937
